para: When this option is enabled, we write an additional column called 'Filename'. The values of this column are filled with filenames of previos input formats.
This can be very helpful for locating specific waypoints (i.e. using the position filter) in more than one file.

example.title: Example for unicsv filename option to write filenames of input formats.
example.para:
The next example ...
gpsbabel -i gpx -f file1.gpx -i gdb -f file2.gdb -o unicsv,filename=1 -F result.txt
... could produce following output:
No,Latitude,Longitude,Name,Date,Time,Filename 1,51.075139,12.463689,"578",2005/04/26,16:27:23,"reference/gdb-sample.gdb" 2,51.081104,12.465277,"579",2005/04/26,16:27:23,"reference/gdb-sample.gdb" 3,50.844126,12.408757,"580",2005/02/26,10:10:47,"reference/gdb-sample.gpx" 4,50.654763,12.204957,"581",2005/02/26,09:57:04,"reference/gdb-sample.gpx"
